intro: Phlomoides bungei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phlomoides, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale blue to purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Phlomoides bungei is often found in dry, rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental qualities in garden settings.
